result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad Allen Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $10,322.72 payable to Judy C.  Joint and several with Melissa Braunreiter in 14CF1522, to which the defendant stipulates.

Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The State advises that the defendant is not eligible by statute, however, the Court will authorize programs and the Department of Correction may make the determination.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brad Allen Hoppe

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied - summarily

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. jbs
on count two.  Defendant's address:  Brad Hoppe #518184, Thompson Correctional Center, 434 State Farm Road, Deerfield, WI  53531.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (45 pages) commencing JANUARY 9, 2015, received and filed.  jm
SENTENCING HEARING Transcript commencing OCTOBER 23, 2014, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1522 (48 Pages).  jm

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Judy C.; John B.; Sharon W.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 120 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 6 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 60 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 60 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The court orders restitution in the amount of $10,322.72 payable to Judy C., joint and several with Melissa Braunreiter in 14CF1522, to which the defendant stipulates.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   The state advises that the defendant is not eligible by statute, however, the court will authorize programs and the Department of Corrections may make the determination.
Defendant is remanded.
Filed: Pretrial credit; Notice of right to seek postconviction relief; Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment; Written explanation of determinate sentence

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel advises the court and counsels that the defendant was involved in a serious auto accident on 10-16-2014 and was hospitalized in ICU for a days and is currently at home under doctor care.  Defense is requesting an adjournment of 60 days for sentencing.  The state has no objection.
Court will STAY a bench warrant to 1-9-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.
Letter has been filed with court from Aurora St. Luke's
restitution as to funeral expenses filed.

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
At court's request matter is adjourned for sentencing to 10-23-2014 at 9:30am.
PSI is given state and defense counsel.

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties waive a PSI, however, the Court orders one be completed.  At the request of defense it is to be done without a recommendation.  Sentencing is adjourned to 9-18-2014 at 8:15am.  Same bail.

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned to 7-10-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA. ls

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brad Allen Hoppe in court with attorney Thomas J Flanagan.  Anthony E White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/2014 at 1:30PM
